titlestmt.titleproper: Elizabeth Bates Carrick collection of World War I memorabilia 1917-1922
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: Elizabeth Bates Carrick collection of World War I memorabilia

bioghist.p: Elizabeth Bates Carrick was a member of Bryn Mawr College's class of 1936. Her father was Captain Guy Bates, who served in World War I in the 102nd U.S. Engineers. He was stationed in France.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of World War I papers and ephemera (1917-1922). Included are letters and postcards to and from Captain Guy Bates; photographs and negatives; memorial programs; a small notebook of accounts; and German instructions for a grenade launcher.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
